feed.title: Combined summary - Last try: Fixes for 0.4

entry.title: Combined summary - Last try: Fixes for 0.4
entry.summary: The author of the article provides information about the bug fixes that are still required in 0.4rc1 and mentions specific branches that contain those bugfixes. These branches include bugfix_getwork_newblk_race, getwork_dedupe, boost_fs3, and gitignore. In addition to these branches, the author also talks about a new branch called base58_liberal_parsing which adds tolerance to human error typing in base58 with ambiguous symbols and is safe to merge.To merge all these branches, the author suggests using the command “git fetch git://gitorious.org/~Luke-Jr/bitcoin/luke-jr-bitcoin.git && git merge FETCH_HEAD”. By following this command, all the bugfixes will be merged into the main codebase, ensuring that the software runs smoothly without any bugs.Overall, the author's article provides important information for developers working on Bitcoin software. By following the suggested steps, they can ensure that all necessary bugfixes are implemented, leading to a more stable and reliable product.
